DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Dose Volume Histogram Volume Unit
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A plot of a cumulative dose-volume frequency distribution that graphically summarizes the simulated radiation distribution within a volume of interest of a patient which would result from a proposed radiation treatment plan._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._Any division of quantity accepted as a standard of measurement or exchange.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A plot of a cumulative dose-volume frequency distribution that graphically summarizes the simulated radiation distribution within a volume of interest of a patient which would result from a proposed radiation treatment plan.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

A plot of a cumulative dose-volume frequency distribution that graphically summarizes the simulated radiation distribution within a volume of interest of a patient which would result from a proposed radiation treatment plan.

Property.preferredDefinition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.:Any division of quantity accepted as a standard of measurement or exchange.

Concepts.definition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/18/19 jk DICOM CDE; Released per qtrly metric review.  12/10/13 created for a Norton (NCI) DICOM RT study. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: CS: A string of characters with leading or trailing spaces being non-significant consisting of Upper Case, 0-9, SPACE, Underscore. [Standard-based]_The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._A straight line through a body or figure that satisfies certain conditions._A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Volume per u with u(dose)=dose -3/2.  The unit PER_U is defined in: Anderson, LL: A natural volume-dose histogram for brachytherapy, Medical Physics 13(6) pp 898-903, 1986.
ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Removed special characters for MDR data migration. 3.16.20 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).

Concepts.definition: A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.:A straight line through a body or figure that satisfies certain conditions.:A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

Concepts.definition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
A straight line through a body or figure that satisfies certain conditions.
A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.
